page.title: 12FORTRIE SHOP
page.content: {Fortrie shop}is a{post office}but it sells nearly everything from{footwear to{seeds.}If you haven't got enough {petrol}you can get this outside. On summer days people buy{ice lollys}and {ice-cream}out of the{deep-freeze.}If you don,t wake up in time for work buy a new{alarm clock.}If you don,t know where your{toy Matchbox lorry}is, just buy another one. If you've torn your good{socks}buy them at the shop too. You can get{milk,}the{paper,}and {Farmers Weekly magazine.}The shop is run by{Mr}and{Mrs Hadden.}Their house is joined on to the shop. Mrs Hadden is in charge of the{Post Office.}There is a{postbox}outside the shop and a {telephone call box.}Most people have a chat when they go to the shop and talk about the weather, farming or the news. {By Ewan Proctor . (Age 9)
